page.title: 14SHOPPING AROUND RIPPINGALE
page.content: A few people,mainly those without their own transport,shop entirely at the{local village stores}and the {mobile traders}but many find the choice of goods rather limited and expensive and prefer to use one of the various towns that lie within a radius of 20 miles,{Bourne,}5 miles away,is well-used,particularly on Thursdays, when there is a{street market,}held since medieval days.{Peterborough}is a great favourite as it has a{modern {centre}with large stores such as John Lewis and Waitrose,all easily accessible from a{multi-storey car {park}and totally under cover.Many prefer the specialist shops of{Boston, whose Wednesday{auctions}are very entertaining.{Grantham's}Saturday {market}attracts many,as does{Stamford with it's{historic buildings and old- {world charm.
